definition: to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs

sentences.english: Pisces skips the whole thing to compose poetry to the Moon.
sentences.chinese: 双鱼座干脆跳过步骤，直接对月吟诗去了。

sentences.english: Legend has it that the young wife of an evil lord fell in love with a 8)troubadour .
sentences.chinese: 传说一个邪恶领主的年轻妻子爱上了一名行吟诗人。

definition: antiphon (i.e. solo voice answered by chorus)/sung reply (in agreement with first voice)/to reply with a poem in the same rhythm

to play the xiao 簫|箫[xiao1] (mouth organ)/to beg while playing pipes; cf politician Wu Zixu 伍子胥[Wu3 Zi3 xu1], c. 520 BC destitute refugee in Wu town, 吳市吹簫|吴市吹箫[Wu2 shi4 chui1 xiao1]/to busk/virtuoso piper wins a beauty, cf 玉人吹簫|玉人吹箫[yu4 ren2 chui1 xiao1]/(slang) fellatio/blowjob
to play the zither/classical variant of 彈琴|弹琴[tan2 qin2]
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
to write or draw with a brush/to put pen to paper/to write
lit. singing of the wind and the moon; fig. vacuous and sentimental (of poetry or art)
to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)
